intro: Anemone coronaria proles coccinea, commonly known as the red poppy, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features striking, showy red or orange flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant has a basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves and produces slender, branching stems. Its flowers are typically five-petaled and have a distinctive, delicate appearance. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes in gardens and landscapes.
